publicationStmt.publisher: Yoav Cohen and Maya Ben Tov, Ben-Gurion University

lg.l: Tossed my lucky penny into a wishing well
Didn't change a thing, oh what the hell
Seems I keep making the same mistakes I've done before
I was trapped under your siren spell but not no more
I lost my tongue when I looked into your eyes
Could not see behind all of those vicious lies
Once you were a seashell on my own deserted shore
Underneath my starry skies but not no more
Whenever we're together, we never went that far
Many times I've wished upon a falling star
Now I see right through you, I don't know what I've bothered for
I cried so many sleepless nights but not no more
